content.label: Hours of entertainment. Loved it.

I enjoyed this interactive puzzler. The storyline was interesting and the gameplay went on much longer than I'd expected.  The puzzle sequences tended to be fairly elaborate and I ended up using the puzzle hints more than I usually like to.  Also the interface was a bit frustrating to wrangle with at times and the game was occasionally glitchy. For instance, I eventually stopped trying to review the manuscript at Nico's apartment because there was no easy way to exit that view. I basically ended up quitting the program, which would "rewind" the scene.  That said, I am looking forward to exploring with other Broken Sword games.

title.label: Game control is retro and counterintuitive

content.label:
Pros: nice comic-book style graphics. Promising and well-designed storyline, even though it seems like a rip-off of Dan Brown's novels. Interesting characters. Best part is the self-deprecating Brit sense of humor.
Cons: the interface is retro-feeling and counterintuitive, it's too troublesome to even walk from place-to-place and put something in the inventory into action. Some of the dialogues are way too long and useless.
Excellent storytelling and engaging gameplay. This game is very nostalgic for me
Few games match the wit and excitement of Broken Sword.

The story is the best part of the game. They totally ripped off "The Da Vinci Code". It has Templars, and archeology puzzles. The game is old and is laughably racist. The game is British made, so you will find a lot of French, middle eastern, and American stereotypes. My problem with the game are more technical, I like adventure games where the interactions between the characters resembles everyday life. If you are right in front of a friendly character that you need to interact, normally you'd just ask a question. There is one interaction in this game, where you have to do 2 unrelated actions, just to get the attention of that character. So basically you have to solve a puzzle, just to do this. Be ready to rely a lot in the hints, A LOT. And not in the game, because the hints you will find are sometimes iffy, the walkthroughs online are your friends.

This game took my breath away. I loved every single minute of this experience. It's like watching a movie & being in the movie all at once! The character voices were fantastic too. Even though there wasn't a ton of puzzles, this game kept me interested from the get-go. More more MORE please!!! Thank the stars above there is another game - so thankful to all who had a hand in its creation!!! Make sure to read about how it all started(courtesy of the Directors Cut)& lastly, the music. So lovely & enjoyable! Thank you again!!

PS. I really liked that we had two main characters. It would've been better if Nico had been utilized more. George had a waaaay bigger part & I feel we missed out on Nico. Great game in spite of this fact......Thanks!

This is by far one of my all time favorite games, and these guys did an excellent job porting it to the idevices. I played Broken Sword during its original Windows95 release, again a few years ago in ScummVM, and will probably play through it once every year or so now that it's in my pocket. Keep up the great work!

The game is really fun in theory but it doesn't work properly. For example, you'll need an item in your inventory but it won't be possible to get it. I found myself stuck for that reason twice and finally just deleted the game. Definitely not worth any money until they figure that stuff out.

Great game will give it five stars when the gate doesn't crash the game anymore.

No more bugs atleast on the devices I use as far as I can tell.

I played this when it came out for the PC in 1996, and loved it ever since. I'm really happy they created it for an iPhone, I'd highly recommend it for being a great story line, fun game and really makes you think to figure out the story. I've played it twice through since I bought it. I wish I could give this game 10 stars because it deserves it. ( also retained the old feeling of this game, with a few extra add ons). It would be great to see more stories following George and Niko, I would definitely buy them.

I was very pleasantly surprised at the excellent production quality and engaging storyline of this game! The characters are well developed, the voice acting is excellent. There are not many games that make you care about the fate of the characters - this is one.
The interface could be improved, especially the hotspots on the screen. They dont always work on the first or second try.
I liked it enough that I will now buy the sequel!
This is a great game with a fantastic story, though i wish i get to use the women more, its seem that u end up using the guy more, nether less its a must buy.
Right off the bat In the first 10 minutes of gameplay. IT'S IMPOSSIBLE TO GET THE HAIRPIN THE THE TABLE TOP. WHAT AN ABSOLUTE WASTE OF TIME AND MONEy!

The graphics, storyline, mechanics and flow are all well done. Sometimes the woman is the primary character and sometimes the man. You help them along on their quest with logic decisions and explorations. This is not a hidden object game, or shoot em up game, thank goodness. It is like the classic adventure games but with way better graphics. What I especially like is the hint system. It will give you one clue at a time so you have the opportunity to just get a tiny hint to move along.  You can save your game at many different spots, in case you ever want to go back or if you share your iPad, and it automatically saves your spot upon exit.
I am getting hours of game play, this is well worth the price of admission (I paid $3.99,which is pretty rare for me). Speaking of which, once you buy the game, that is it. None of the pay for extra hints,  or in-app purchases or any additional charges, which I appreciate, because I expect to pay only one reasonable price for a game and that is it! I see this developer has a sequel game to this, which I will get, but I hope they are making more. It looks like the game "Runaway" is of the same genre, but $1 more, so I might check that out down the road....
The way you move around and play this game is old-fashioned even by PC standards. On an iPad it's downright laughable. Waste of money.  Some small marks for the effort in the story.
Gorgeous art style, great voice acting.  This is pixel hunting at its finest.  Must have app... Really good for short or long play sessions.
Crashes at the point where Nico opens safe...

There is an very annoying bug that making this game unplayable or a game breaker. Near the beginning of the game. I found the key to the safe and when Nico opens it. The game crush and I never get past that part. PLEASE fix this, 3 stars will return once the game is fix

This is a very lengthy and well-designed game. Each interaction has a voiceover; and when you start to think about the number of item and people combinations, the amount of time it must have taken to record the voice actors for this release is staggering. The dialogue is witty and funny. The story reminds me of The Da Vinci Code. A little slow-paced at times. A+

title.label: Great game, but a major annoying bug

content.label: It's a great game and the sometimes lacking graphics aren't too bad, they just throw you back in the PlayStation era. I consider this more as a nostalgic port. However, there's a major bug, where towards the end of the game (it starts at the end of Syria I think) looking at your notes crashes the app.

One of my favourite video games. Played it when I was younger on PC and now on iPad. Still feels nice. Animatons look good and the game just pulls you in with great story, nice voice acting and rich graphics. 
Need more games like this today.
I love the game but looks like crap on the ipad 3 n I don't see the hd version only in other languages please make it for retina display please n il give 5 stars again
I'd give five star, but the games crashes in the beginning! Nico opens the safe and it crashes. Fix it, please. iPad 2, 6.1

First off, this is my favorite adventure game ever! But, as Xeno said, there is an annoying crash after the lock puzzle in the beginning. Will definitely change to five stars once this is fixed. Otherwise, thanks for making this universal. Came just in time for my iPad mini. And I am eagerly awaiting 'The Serpent's Curse' :)

Edit: I found that by changing the subtitles to the UK setting, it fixed it for some reason.
Like reading a mystery novel before bed. Only you have to do all the work. Enjoying it very much.
It's nice to play a game that actually makes you think instead of just having to shoot and kill tons if people.
Intriguing and enjoyable.
I love this game it's worth every penny! They should have more games like this!
exactly what I was looking for. a great point and click adventure
Great game, classic
Easily one of the best games on iOS, bar none.
Fun puzzles, good plot and nice voice acting.
Not too easy, not too hard. Very well thought out and engaging.

title.label: One of the best adventure games.

content.label: Plot, story, characters are all top notch.
really fun game!! worth every penny, i bought both of them and hope they make more!
The story, art style and voice acting make this a lot of fun
Very fun mystery point and click game
Very fun, very well thought out, gorgeous game. Worth every single penny and more.
Love the game and the graphics
I just completed this game and it was unbelievably fun! Totally worth the money!
Wish they made more of these old adventure classics.
A break from driving and zombie killing.
From the graphics, to the storyline, and the gameplay, this game has it all!  You will definitely be intrigued and busy for hours.
A good game, just challenging enough.

title.label: Please make more games like this

content.label: Please?

title.label: This is truly a fun game

content.label: I highly recommend it!
it's so great! Plus there's no need to pay for anything :D
Good game, plays very intuitively. Even has a help menu if you happen to get stuck.

This was an awesome game. It reminded me of all those old games I love like Indiana Jones and the lost city of Atlantis, Monkey Islands, Loom, and so many others.  Great responsiveness to the touch screen and no crashes.
